In the final chapter, you will learn how to do a detox correctly!
The point is to get your brain back in balanced state. This is done by targeting the main behaviors that
The more you can reduce the flow, the better. However, you don\'t have to cut it off fully - in fact, that\'s just impossible. Focus on cutting it down as much as you can handle.
Your brain has developed a tolerance towards dopamine (as discussed in the previous chapter about tolerance), and your task is to get rid of that tolerance.
Think about stuff that you really want, but isn\'t healthy.\n\nFor example, as we already mentioned, there is technology usage.

This one is probably the most important, because lately it has been on a steady rise and it\'s severely affecting our brain in mostly negative ways.\n\nThink about places where you take your phone not to be bored - for example, the toilet. Try to evade this behavior.
The next important thing is food.\n\nThink about food which is unhealthy, but you always give in to the urge to buy and eat it.

There has also been a heavy rise in porn addiction.\n\nIf you are someone who struggles with that (or any other urge as a matter of fact), try to learn how to control your urges. For example, look up urge surfing.

Try your best to completely avoid these and other activities you might come up with (even avoid this app if it helps!), but don\'t beat yourself up too much if you fail to from time to time. Keep going.

Remember, this is about endurance, not about flawlessness.\n \nYou are going to experience a lot of boredom. Try to come up with fun, healthy activities that you can do to fill your free time. You could also experience some negative emotions, so be ready.
If you think you are ready, it\'s time to start the timer!

Choose the difficulty you prefer and try to stay truthful.

You should tolerate some screw-ups, but don't keep the timer going if you know you completely failed, just go again and maybe choose an easier difficulty, there's no point in giving up :-)

Good luck!
